latex: Let $\{\omega_1,\omega_2,\cdots,\omega_{100}\}$ be the roots of $\frac{x^{101}-1}{x-1}$ (in some order). Consider the set $$S=\{\omega_1^1,\omega_2^2,\omega_3^3,\cdots,\omega_{100}^{100}\}.$$Let $M$ be the maximum possible number of unique values in $S,$ and let $N$ be the minimum possible number of unique values in $S.$ Find $M-N.$
